intro: Oenothera falfurriae, commonly known as the Falfurria sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oenothera falfurriae is adapted to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
